question: Ethan wants to make different sized ice cubes with 196 poundss of water. He can make giant cubes that use 8 poundss per cube, medium cubes that use 3 poundss, and small cubes that use 1/8 pounds. If he makes 4 giant cubes, 10 medium cubes, and 8 small cubes, how many poundss of water does he have left?
answer:
The giant cubes used up 32 poundss of water because 4 times 8 equals <<4*8=32>>32.
The medium cubes used up 30 poundss of water because 10 times 3 equals <<10*3=30>>30.
The small cubes used up 1 poundss of water because 8 times 1/8 equals 1.
This means that Ethan has used up 63 poundss of water because 32 plus 30 plus 1 equals 63.
Ethan has 133 poundss of water left because 196 minus 63 equals <<196-63=133>>133.
#### 133
